item.title: Issue #748 created
item.description:
Parse functions: consistency

Updated (31-01-2025): Aligned with latest XQFO spec.

The functions for parsing input have been defined by different people, and the current state is quite inconsistent:

Function | Parameters --- | --- fn:parse-xml | $value as xs:string?, $options as map(*)? fn:doc | $source as xs:string? fn:parse-json | $value as xs:string?, $options as map(*)? fn:json-doc | $source as xs:string?, $options as map(*)? fn:parse-html | $html as (xs:string \| xs:hexBinary \| xs:base64Binary)?, $options as map(*)? fn:parse-csv | $csv as xs:string?, $options as map(*)?

I believe thereâ€™s some need to unify the functions. We should:

  • add fn:csv-doc($source, $options) and fn:html-doc($source, $options),
  • rename the argument of all fn:parse-... functions to $value,
  • enhance all fn:parse-... functions to also accept binaries, and
  • always return an empty sequence if the source/input argument is empty.

See #1021 for fn:doc.
